sailpoint.object

Class LockInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.LockInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject

    public class LockInfo
extends AbstractXmlObject
implements java.io.Serializable
    Helper class for managing the SailPointObject.lock property.

    The lock property is a string formatted using a delimiter between the sub-fields. This class provides a parser for that string and a more convenient programming model.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_LOCK_TIMEOUT

        public static final int DEFAULT_LOCK_TIMEOUT
        The default lock lock timeout in minutes. This can be overridden in the system configuration.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_LONG_LOCK_TIMEOUT

        public static final int DEFAULT_LONG_LOCK_TIMEOUT
        The default lock timeout in minutes for tasks that run a long time. This value will be used if the Configuration.LONG_RUNNING_LOCK_TIMEOUT is not set.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_LOCK_TIMEOUT

        public static final int MAX_LOCK_TIMEOUT
        The maximum lock timeout allowed. Unlike like most parameters it is important that this one have a reasonable value, so if the user just types 99999 in the config page, it is brought back to something reasonable to reality.

        Two hours should be more than enough to hold onto something.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • setConfiguration

        public static void setConfiguration(Configuration config)
        Assimilate configuration options. This is intended to be called by InternalContext during the initial bootstrapping of the first prototype context. The system configuration object is known and can be accessed to pull out interesting things.

      • setName

        @Deprecated
public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Deprecated. 
        Set the lock name. This is no longer to be used in system code, all system code must use the automatically generated id for this thread.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Get the unique id of the thread that owns this lock. This is normally generated by the getThreadLockId method in this class. Prior to 5.0 it was sometimes a user specified name.

      • setAcquired

      • setExpiration

        public void setExpiration(java.util.Date d)

      • getExpiration

        public java.util.Date getExpiration()
        The date the lock was expires. This can be null, in which case the expiration will be calculated at runtime relative to acquired using a configurable expiration.

      • setContext

        public void setContext(java.lang.String s)
        Optional extra information about the thread that aquired the lock. When set this is typically a TaskDefinition name used to diagnose the source of lock leaks.

      • getContext

        public java.lang.String getContext()

        public void refresh(int minutes)
        Increment the lock expiration by some number of minutes.

      • refresh

        public void refresh()

      • isExpired

        public boolean isExpired()

      • render

        public java.lang.String render()
        The format of the lock string will look like this:

        name|acquired|expired|context

        This allows you to search on locks for a particular user with a LIKE from the beginning up to the first |. It does mean that | is not allowed in names but that is a reasonable restriction.

        If a name with a | is found it will be escaped with backslash so they can be at least gotten in and out without corruption. You will not be able search on the entire name though since LIKE does not understand the escaping convention.

      • parse

        public void parse(java.lang.String src)
           throws GeneralException
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • describe

        public java.lang.String describe()

      • print

        public void print()

      • verify

        public static void verify(SailPointObject obj,
                          java.lang.String task)
        Verify that an object lock was held and has not expired. Used by agg and refresh to log expiration errors.

      • getThreadLockId

        public static java.lang.String getThreadLockId()
        Return the unique locking id for this thread. This may be used in system code to generate the "lockName" argument that appears in many methods, but it should all eventually migrate to not passing an explicit lockName and letting it auto-generate in render().

      • peekThreadLockId

        public static java.lang.String peekThreadLockId()
        Return the unique locking id for this thread if one exists. This is intended only for Hibernate layer code to check to see if a locking id was property generated.

      • setThreadLockContext

        public static void setThreadLockContext(java.lang.String s)
        Set the lock context information. Tasks should remember to unset this when they're done. Moved to LockTracker, leave these old method behind so we efix less code.

      • getThreadLockContext

        public static java.lang.String getThreadLockContext()
